thread.title: How to make cash quickly from unwanted goods
thread.title_full: How to make cash quickly from unwanted goods

author: Sophie Elsworth MoneysaverHQ deputy editor
title: How to make cash quickly from unwanted goods
text:
UNWANTED items lying right in front of your own eyes could make you a quick buck.
Buying and selling goods on popular websites including Gumtree are easy ways to snare bargains or make yourself some handy cash.
Just ask do-it-yourself specialist Natasha Dickins who found a broken classic Swedish designer chair on the site for $25.
After she gave it a little spruce it’s since been valued at $4000.
MORE: How to build a budget
LOOK AROUND
Dickins says every Australian garage has a chair or piece of furniture in it that’s unloved and of some value.
New research by Gumtree showed 89 per cent of the population have unwanted items lying around the house.
So start by hunting around your home and garage and see if there’s any unwanted items that you think someone else might pay some money for.
“It’s just a matter of keeping an eye out, if you like it someone else would like it,’’ Dickins says.
“There’s also an opportunity to look around your house and give it a clean out.”
The data showed 61 per cent of respondents are open to the idea of selling second-hand goods online to make money to help with costs such as saving for a house deposit.
PHOTOGRAPHS
Celebrity second-hand expert Adam McDonald says having the best photographs online as possible is critical for both buyers and sellers.
He also says having the more photos the better and urges users to be honest in what they show.
If a piece of furniture has any nips and tucks on it be transparent and show this or otherwise it could result in problems down the track.
BE REALISTIC
Look online and see what prices the same or similar items are selling for.
Set a price point that you think people would be prepared to pay, don’t be greedy as you’re probably just wasting your time.
McDonald says millions of items are posted online every week so if you don’t find what you are looking for in the first instance, be patient.
For those who are buying set a price limit and don’t go over it.
This reporter is on Twitter: @sophieelsworth
